newsitem.title: JAPAN: Tokyo rubber futures firmer on short-covering.
newsitem.headline: Tokyo rubber futures firmer on short-covering.

text.p: Tokyo rubber futures ended firmer across the board on Thursday, lifted by short-covering from trade houses, traders said.
Prices ranged from 0.9 yen to 1.8 yen per kg higher.
Benchmark October closed 1.7 yen up at 140.0 yen.
Activity was lacklustre. A moderate fall in Japan's rubber stocks as of April 30 released in the afternoon, also provided psychological support, the traders said.
Prices opened weaker, but caution based on a perception that prices were low, stimulated moderate short-covering, they said. --Tokyo Commodity Desk, +81-3-3432-7431
